feed.title: Google Cloud: Google SecOps SOAR
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Google SecOps SOAR

entry.content:
CSV: Version 35.0

  • Updated file path processing logic in the following connector:

  • CSV Connector
entry.summary: The CSV connector has been updated with improved file path processing logic.
entry.title: Changed: CSV Connector Update

entry.content:
CrowdStrike Falcon: Version 68.0

  • Update the following action to check if there is an existing identical running scan for a provided hostname before creating a new one:

  • On-Demand Scan
entry.summary: The CrowdStrike Falcon platform has been updated to version 68.0. This release includes an enhancement to the On-Demand Scan feature. It now checks for existing identical running scans on a given hostname before initiating a new one, preventing redundant scans.
entry.title: Changed: CrowdStrike Falcon v68.0 Update

entry.content:
Exchange: Version 115.0

  • Updated the file management logic in the following action:

  • Download Attachments
entry.summary: Exchange 115.0 has been released, featuring an update to the Download Attachments action's file management logic.
entry.title: Changed: Exchange 115.0

entry.content:
Microsoft Graph Mail: Version 32.0

  • Updated the file management logic in the following action:

  • Download Attachments from Email
entry.summary: Version 32.0 of Microsoft Graph Mail has been released. This update includes changes to the file management logic for the Download Attachments from Email action.
entry.title: Changed: Microsoft Graph Mail v32.0 Update

entry.content:
Microsoft Graph Mail Delegated: Version 9.0

  • Updated the file management logic in the following action:

  • Download Attachments from Email
entry.summary: The file management logic in the Download Attachments from Email action has been updated.
entry.title: Changed: Updated File Management Logic

entry.content:
Palo Alto Cortex XDR: Version 19.0

  • Updated incident processing logic in the following action:

  • Get Incident Details

  • Added new filtering options, the ability to create a SecOps alert for every Palo Alto XDR alert, and the ability to track updates to an incident in the following connector:

  • Palo Alto Cortex XDR Connector
entry.summary: The Palo Alto Cortex XDR product has been updated to version 19.0. This update includes changes to the 'Get Incident Details' action's processing logic. Additionally, the Palo Alto Cortex XDR Connector now features new filtering options, the capability to generate SecOps alerts for each Palo Alto XDR alert, and the ability to monitor incident updates.
entry.title: Changed: Palo Alto Cortex XDR - Version 19.0 Update

entry.content:
Tanium: Version 15.0

  • (REGRESSIVE) Updated JSON result to return data for multiple columns in the following action:

  • Get Question Results
entry.summary: Version 15.0 of Tanium has been released. This update includes a regression fix for the 'Get Question Results' action, ensuring data for multiple columns is correctly returned in JSON format.
entry.title: Changed: Tanium 15.0 Update

entry.content:
ZScaler: Version 10.0

  • Added support for domain entity type in the following actions:

  • Add to Whitelist

  • Lookup Entity
entry.summary: Version 10.0 of ZScaler now supports the domain entity type for Whitelist and Lookup Entity actions.
entry.title: Changed: ZScaler 10.0 Update

entry.content:
Release 6.3.65 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions as listed here.

This release contains the following changes:
entry.summary: Release 6.3.65 is now live in initial regions. Check the documentation for details.
entry.title: Announcement: New Release Available

entry.content:
Delete high-load environments

You can now easily delete environments with heavy loads directly from the platform.
entry.summary: Easily delete high-load environments directly from the platform.
entry.title: Feature: Delete high-load environments

entry.content: Release 6.3.64 is now available for all regions.
entry.summary: The latest update, Release 6.3.64, has been successfully deployed and is now accessible across all regions.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.64 Now Available

entry.content:
CSV: Version 34.0

  • Fixed a bug that caused inconsistent column order for the same JSON input by stabilizing the order based on the keys of the first object in the list in the following action:

  • Save Json to CSV
entry.summary: The latest update to CSV (version 34.0) includes a fix for inconsistent column order in the Save JSON to CSV action. The column order will now be stable, based on the keys of the first JSON object.
entry.title: Changed: CSV Version 34.0 Update

entry.content:
DomainTools: Version 8.0

  • Extended capabilities in the following action:

  • Get Domain Risk

  • Added support for the domain entity type in the following actions:

  • Get Domain Profile

  • Get Domain Risk
  • Reverse Domain
entry.summary: Version 8.0 of DomainTools brings enhanced capabilities to the 'Get Domain Risk' action and adds support for the domain entity type across 'Get Domain Profile', 'Get Domain Risk', and 'Reverse Domain' actions.
entry.title: Changed: DomainTools 8.0 Update

entry.content:
SentinelOneV2: Version 42.0

  • The following new actions have been added:

  • Create Device Control Rule

  • Delete Device Control Rule
  • Update Device Control Rule
entry.summary: Version 42.0 of SentinelOne introduces new capabilities for managing device control rules, including options to create, delete, and update them.
entry.title: Feature: New Device Control Features

entry.content:
CrowdStrike Falcon: Version 67.0

  • Fixed a bug where the Contains filter would fail to find hosts when the Max Hosts To Return limit was applied in the following action:

  • List Host
entry.summary: Version 67.0 of CrowdStrike Falcon addresses a bug affecting host searches with the Contains filter when the Max Hosts To Return limit was active. This fix ensures accurate host retrieval in the List Host action.
entry.title: Changed: CrowdStrike Falcon 67.0 Update

entry.content:
Release 6.3.64 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions as listed here.

This release contains internal and customer bug fixes.
entry.summary: The new release 6.3.64 is now being rolled out to initial regions. This update includes important bug fixes for our users.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.64 Now Available

entry.content: Release 6.3.63 is now available for all regions.
entry.summary: The latest update, Release 6.3.63, has been successfully deployed and is now accessible across all regions.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.63 Available

entry.content:
CrowdStrike Falcon: Version 66.0

  • The following new action has been added:

  • Get Alert Details
entry.summary: A new 'Get Alert Details' action has been added to CrowdStrike Falcon version 66.0.
entry.title: Feature: CrowdStrike Falcon v66.0 Alert Details

entry.content:
Azure Active Directory: Version 19.0

  • Improved performance by implementing a direct API filter query for group name searches, which avoids fetching all groups and significantly reduces execution time in large-group environments, in the following action:

  • List Members in Group
entry.summary: Performance improvements for group name searches in 'List Members in Group' action.
entry.title: Changed: Azure Active Directory v19.0

entry.content:
CrowdStrike Falcon: Version 66.0

  • Updated entity processing logic in the following actions:

  • Contain Endpoint

  • Download File
  • Execute Command
  • Get Host Information
  • Lift Contained Endpoint
  • List Host Vulnerabilities
  • On-Demand Scan
  • Run Script
entry.summary: The CrowdStrike Falcon app has been updated to version 66.0. This release includes changes to entity processing logic in several actions, such as Contain Endpoint, Download File, and Execute Command.
entry.title: Changed: CrowdStrike Falcon v66.0 Update

entry.content:
Updated dependencies in the following integrations:

  • Microsoft Teams: Version 30.0
  • Microsoft Graph Mail Delegated: Version 8.0
  • Exchange: Version 114.0
  • Case Federation: Version 5.0
  • Azure Security Center: Version 12.0
entry.summary: We have updated dependencies in several integrations, including Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Graph Mail Delegated, Exchange, Case Federation, and Azure Security Center.
entry.title: Changed: Updated Integrations

entry.content:
Microsoft Teams: Version 30.0

  • Integration: Fixed an issue with the special characters in the query parameters.
entry.summary: Microsoft Teams has been updated to version 30.0. This update includes a fix for an issue with special characters in query parameters.
entry.title: Changed: Microsoft Teams Update

entry.content:
Okta: Version 10.0

  • Updated the pagination processing mechanism in the following actions:

  • List Users

  • Add Group
  • Get Group
  • List Providers
entry.summary: Okta has released version 10.0, featuring updates to pagination processing in the List Users, Add Group, Get Group, and List Providers actions.
entry.title: Changed: Okta 10.0 Release

entry.content:
ThreatQ: Version 15.0

  • Updated the API request payload to align with a change in the ThreatQ API in the following actions:

  • Enrich IP

  • Enrich URL
  • Enrich Email
  • Enrich Hash
  • Enrich CVE
entry.summary: The API request payload has been updated to match recent changes in the ThreatQ API for Enrich IP, Enrich URL, Enrich Email, Enrich Hash, and Enrich CVE actions.
entry.title: Changed: ThreatQ v15.0 API Update

entry.content:
UrlScan.io: Version 26.0

  • Added ability to scan domains and IPs in the following action:

  • URL Check
entry.summary: UrlScan.io has been updated to version 26.0. This new version includes the ability to scan domains and IPs within the URL Check action.
entry.title: Changed: UrlScan.io v26.0

entry.content:
Google Workspace: Version 22.0

  • Updated the action description to reflect that the action deletes the extension from the blocklist rather than deleting the extension from the organizational unit in the following action:

  • Delete Extension
entry.summary: The 'Delete Extension' action in Google Workspace has been updated. It now removes the extension from the blocklist instead of deleting it from the organizational unit.
entry.title: Changed: Extension action updated

entry.content:
Google Chronicle: Version 66.0

  • Updated processing of reference list rows in the following action:

  • Get Reference Lists
entry.summary: Version 66.0 of Google Chronicle has been released. This update includes changes to how reference lists are processed in the Get Reference Lists action.
entry.title: Changed: Google Chronicle Update

entry.content:
Google Threat Intelligence: Version 5.0

  • Added ability to filter by issue name in the following connector:

  • Google Threat Intelligence - ASM Issues Connector

  • Added ability to filter events in the following connector:

  • Google Threat Intelligence - DTM Alerts Connector
entry.summary: Version 5.0 of Google Threat Intelligence now includes filtering by issue name in the ASM Issues Connector and event filtering in the DTM Alerts Connector.
entry.title: Changed: Google Threat Intelligence Update

entry.content:
Microsoft Teams: Version 29.0

  • Refactored action logic in the following actions:

  • Get Authorization

  • Generate Token
entry.summary: The Microsoft Teams app has been updated to version 29.0. This update includes refactoring of the action logic for 'Get Authorization' and 'Generate Token' actions.
entry.title: Changed: Microsoft Teams Update

entry.content:
Release 6.3.63 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions as listed here.

This release contains internal and customer bug fixes.
entry.summary: Release 6.3.63 is now available in initial regions. This update includes important bug fixes for our users.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.63 Rollout

entry.content: Release 6.3.62 is now available for all regions.
entry.summary: The latest update, Release 6.3.62, has been successfully deployed and is now accessible across all regions.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.62 Available

entry.content:
Release 6.3.62 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions, as outlined in our Google SecOps release plan.

This release contains the following changes:
entry.summary: Release 6.3.62 is now available in initial regions, following the established release plan. This update includes several important changes.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.62 Rollout

entry.content:
Podman support for Remote Agents

You can now install a Remote Agent using Podman. This new functionality provides a streamlined deployment workflow—a lightweight alternative to existing installation methods.

For more information, see Deploy an agent with Podman.
entry.summary: Install a Remote Agent using Podman for a streamlined, lightweight deployment.
entry.title: Feature: Podman support for Remote Agents

entry.content:
Deploy an agent with Debian

You can now install a Remote Agent using Debian. This new functionality provides a streamlined deployment workflow—an alternative to existing installation methods.

For more information, see Deploy an agent with Debian.
entry.summary: A new feature allows for streamlined agent deployment using Debian.
entry.title: Feature: Agent Deployment on Debian

entry.content: Remote Agent, Release 2.5.0 contains the following changes:
entry.summary: New release of Remote Agent available.
entry.title: Announcement: Remote Agent 2.5.0

entry.content:
Increased Alert Trimming limit for Remote Agent

The default setting for Alert Trimming has been increased to 25 MB.
entry.summary: The default setting for Alert Trimming has been increased to 25 MB.
entry.title: Changed: Increased Alert Trimming limit

entry.content:
Publisher Connector package size limit enforced

The maximum allowed size for a Publisher's Connector Package is now limited to 25 MB.
entry.summary: The maximum size for a Publisher's Connector Package is now 25 MB.
entry.title: Changed: Connector Package Size Limit

entry.content: Release 6.3.61 is now available for all regions.
entry.summary: The latest release, version 6.3.61, is now available for all regions. This update includes important changes and improvements.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.61 Available

entry.content: New Apache Kafka integration
entry.summary: We're excited to announce our new integration with Apache Kafka. This feature allows for seamless data streaming and processing.
entry.title: Feature: New Kafka Integration

entry.content:
Microsoft Azure Sentinel: Version 57.0

  • The following new job has been added:

  • Sync Incidents
entry.summary: A new 'Sync Incidents' job has been added.
entry.title: Feature: Sync Incidents Feature

entry.content:
Any.Run: Version 8.0

  • Updated the available privacy settings in the following actions:

  • Analyze URL

  • Analyze File URL
  • Analyze File
entry.summary: We have updated the privacy settings for Analyze URL, Analyze File URL, and Analyze File actions.
entry.title: Changed: Any.Run 8.0 Release

entry.content:
CrowdStrike Falcon: Version 64.0

  • Updated timeout handling in the following connector:

  • Crowdstrike Falcon - Streaming Events Connector

  • Integration: Updated authentication to support multi-tenancy execution.
entry.summary: Timeout handling has been improved in the Streaming Events Connector. Authentication has also been updated to support multi-tenancy.
entry.title: Changed: Crowdstrike Falcon v6.4.0 Update

entry.content:
Google Workspace: Version 21.0

  • Expanded capabilities of the following action:

  • List OU Of Account

  • Updated processing of the organization unit inside the following actions:

  • Block Extension

  • Delete Extension
  • List OU Of Account
entry.summary: Google Workspace has been updated to version 21.0. This update expands the capabilities of the 'List OU Of Account' action and improves the organization unit processing for 'Block Extension', 'Delete Extension', and 'List OU Of Account' actions.
entry.title: Changed: Google Workspace: Version 21.0

entry.content:
Orca Security: Version 12.0

  • Integration: (REGRESSIVE) Updated to support the latest API version.

Ontology has been updated. Overwrite current ontology mapping to align with the new API alert structure.
entry.summary: Orca Security has released version 12.0, featuring an update to support the latest API version. This includes an updated ontology to align with the new API alert structure.
entry.title: Changed: Orca Security 12.0 Release Notes

entry.content:
Google Chronicle: Version 65.0

  • Updated the filtering mechanism of the following action:

  • Get Data Tables
entry.summary: The filtering mechanism for the Get Data Tables action has been updated in Google Chronicle version 65.0.
entry.title: Changed: Google Chronicle V65.0 Update

entry.content:
SentinelOneV2: Version 41.0

  • The following new action has been added:

  • Update Alert

  • The following new connector has been added:

  • SentinelOne - Alert Connector

  • A new predefined widget has been added to the following action:

  • Update Alert
entry.summary: SentinelOneV2 version 41.0 introduces a new Update Alert action and a SentinelOne - Alert Connector. Additionally, a predefined widget has been added for the Update Alert action.
entry.title: Feature: New features in SentinelOneV2

entry.content:
Google Threat Intelligence: Version 4.0

  • The following new action has been added:

  • Set DTM Alert Analysis
entry.summary: A new feature, Set DTM Alert Analysis, has been added to Google Threat Intelligence Version 4.0. This enhancement allows for more detailed analysis of DTM alerts.
entry.title: Feature: New DTM Alert Analysis Feature

entry.content:
Palo Alto Cortex XDR: Version 18.0

  • The following new actions have been added:

  • Add Comment To Incident

  • Execute XQL Search
  • Get Incident Details
entry.summary: The new version of Palo Alto Cortex XDR, 18.0, introduces powerful new incident management features. You can now add comments directly to incidents, execute XQL searches for deeper analysis, and retrieve detailed incident information.
entry.title: Feature: Palo Alto Cortex XDR 18.0 Update

entry.content:
Google Threat Intelligence: Version 4.0

  • Updated the processing of the threat actor entity in the following action:

  • Enrich Entities

  • Updated the predefined widget in the following actions:

(REGRESSIVE) The widget now works with GTI information. To see the changes, the widget must be re-added to the existing views in playbooks.

  • Enrich Entities
  • Enrich IOCs

  • Added JSON samples to the following action:

  • Enrich Entities
entry.summary: Version 4.0 of Google Threat Intelligence has been released, featuring updates to the Enrich Entities and Enrich IOCs actions. This includes enhanced threat actor entity processing, updated predefined widgets (which may require re-adding to existing views), and the addition of JSON samples for the Enrich Entities action.
entry.title: Changed: Google Threat Intelligence Update

entry.content:
Trend Vision One: Version 6.0

  • Added support for Agent UUID in the following actions:

  • Enrich Entities

  • Execute Custom Script
  • Isolate Endpoint
  • Unisolate Endpoint
entry.summary: Version 6.0 of Trend Vision One now supports Agent UUID for actions like Enrich Entities, Execute Custom Script, Isolate Endpoint, and Unisolate Endpoint.
entry.title: Changed: Trend Vision One 6.0 Update

entry.content:
Splunk: Version 58.0

  • Updated the alert processing logic in the following connector:

  • Splunk ES - Notable Events Connector
entry.summary: Splunk ES Notable Events Connector: Alert processing logic updated in version 58.0.
entry.title: Changed: Splunk ES Notable Events Connector Update

entry.content:
Jira: Version 48.0

  • Integration: Updated the SDK version.
entry.summary: The SDK version has been updated for Version 48.0.
entry.title: Changed: SDK Version Update

entry.content:
Added the ability to modify the API Root and Login API Root in the following integrations:

  • Azure Active Directory: Version 18.0
  • Azure AD Identity Protection: Version 7.0
  • Microsoft Teams: Version 28.0
entry.summary: The Azure Active Directory, Azure AD Identity Protection, and Microsoft Teams integrations have been updated. You can now modify the API Root and Login API Root for these integrations.
entry.title: Changed: Azure AD integrations updated

entry.content:
Vertex AI: Version 4.0

  • Integration: Increased the default timeout for API requests.
entry.summary: The default timeout for API requests in Vertex AI has been increased.
entry.title: Changed: Vertex AI API timeout increased

entry.content:
Microsoft Azure Sentinel: Version 56.0

  • Updated mapping for the ScheduledAlert event types in the following connector:

  • Microsoft Azure Sentinel Incident Connector v2
entry.summary: A new version of the Microsoft Azure Sentinel Incident Connector v2 is available, featuring updated mapping for ScheduledAlert event types.
entry.title: Changed: Azure Sentinel Update

entry.content:
Migrate SOAR to Google Cloud

All customers and partners are being migrated from SOAR to Google Cloud. For more information, see SOAR migration overview and FAQ.
entry.summary: All customers and partners are being migrated from SOAR to Google Cloud. This transition is part of an ongoing effort to enhance our services and provide a more robust platform. For detailed information and assistance, please refer to the SOAR migration overview and FAQ resources.
entry.title: Announcement: SOAR Migration to Google Cloud

entry.content:
Release 6.3.61 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions as listed here.

This release contains internal and customer bug fixes.
entry.summary: The latest release, version 6.3.61, is now being deployed to initial regions. This update includes important bug fixes for both internal systems and our customers.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.61 Rolling Out

entry.content: Release 6.3.60 is now available for all regions.
entry.summary: The latest update, Release 6.3.60, has been deployed and is now accessible across all regions.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.60 Available

entry.content:
Release 6.3.61 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions, as outlined in our Google SecOps release plan.

This release contains the following features:
entry.summary: Release 6.3.61 is now available in the initial set of regions, following the established release plan. This update introduces new features designed to enhance our offerings.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.61 Rolling Out

entry.content:
Advanced job scheduling

The job scheduling functionality has been enhanced with advanced options. This functionality provides more precise control and flexible, calendar-like scheduling for your scripts.

For more information, see Configure a new job with advanced scheduling.
entry.summary: Enhanced job scheduling with advanced options for precise control and flexible, calendar-like scheduling of scripts.
entry.title: Feature: Advanced job scheduling

entry.content:
Use custom fields in the Close Case dialog

Administrators can now add custom fields to the Close Case dialog. This new functionality provides a more streamlined workflow and replaces the Dynamic Fields feature.

For more information, see Use custom fields in the Close Case dialog.
entry.summary: Administrators can now add custom fields to the Close Case dialog, streamlining workflows. This feature replaces the older Dynamic Fields functionality.
entry.title: Feature: New Custom Fields for Case Closure

entry.content: Release 6.3.60 is now available for all regions.
entry.summary: The latest update, version 6.3.60, has been released and is now available in all regions.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.60 Now Available

entry.content:
Google Threat Intelligence: Version 3.0

  • Extended supported filters in the following connector:

  • Google Threat Intelligence - ASM Issues Connector
entry.summary: Version 3.0 of Google Threat Intelligence is now available, featuring extended supported filters in the ASM Issues Connector.
entry.title: Changed: Google Threat Intelligence Update

entry.content:
Release 6.3.60 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions as listed here.

This release contains internal and customer bug fixes.
entry.summary: Release 6.3.60 is now available in initial regions. This update includes bug fixes.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.60 Rollout

entry.content: Release 6.3.59 is now available for all regions.
entry.summary: The latest release, version 6.3.59, is now available in all regions.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.59 Available

Google Workspace: Version 20.0

  • The following new actions have been added:

  • Block Extension

  • Delete Extension
  • Get Extension Details
  • Get Host Browser Details
  • Search User Activity Events
entry.summary: Google Workspace now includes new actions: Block Extension, Delete Extension, Get Extension Details, Get Host Browser Details, and Search User Activity Events.
entry.title: Feature: New Actions Available for Google Workspace

entry.content:
Google Threat Intelligence: Version 3.0

  • Integration: Updated authentication flow.
entry.summary: Version 3.0 of Google Threat Intelligence is here, featuring an updated authentication flow.

entry.content:
Release 6.3.59 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions as listed here.

This release contains internal and customer bug fixes.
entry.summary: Release 6.3.59 is now available in initial regions.
entry.title: Announcement: New Release Available

entry.content: Release 6.3.58 is now available for all regions.
entry.summary: Release 6.3.58 is now available.
entry.title: Announcement: New Release Available

entry.content:
Release 6.3.58 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions as listed here.

This release contains internal and customer bug fixes.
entry.summary: Bug fixes in release 6.3.58.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.58

entry.content: Release 6.3.57 is now available for all regions.
entry.summary: Release 6.3.57 is now available.
entry.title: Announcement: New Release Available

entry.content:
Release 6.3.57 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions, as outlined in our Google SecOps release plan.

This release contains the following features:
entry.summary: Release 6.3.57 is rolling out now.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.57 Rollout

entry.content:
Expression Builder enhancements

The Expression Builder has been enhanced with a new set of pre-built filters to help streamline query creation.

We've improved the information within the platform for all filters, both new and existing. The supporting documentation provides clearer descriptions and practical examples for each transformer, making it easier to understand their purpose and syntax.

For details, see Use the Expression Builder.
entry.summary: New filters in Expression Builder.
entry.title: Feature: Expression Builder Enhancements

entry.content:
Remote agent notifications

Agent notifications will alert you to new remote agent version releases and agent downtime based on your permissions and associated environments. Agent notifications are now enabled by default. You can opt out of these notifications at any time from your user preferences.

For details, see Agent notifications.
entry.summary: Agent notifications alert you to new remote agent version releases and agent downtime.
entry.title: Feature: Remote Agent Notifications

entry.content: Release 6.3.56 is now available for all regions.
entry.summary: Release 6.3.56 is now available.
entry.title: Announcement: New Release Available

entry.content:
Release 6.3.56 is rolling out to the first phase of regions, as outlined in our Google SecOps release plan.

This release includes the following features:
entry.summary: Release 6.3.56 is now available in initial regions.
entry.title: Announcement: New Release Available

entry.content:
Automated retries for failed playbook actions

This feature is in Preview.

Playbook functionality now supports automatic retries for individual actions that encounter temporary issues, such as network outages, API rate limits, or service unavailability. You can define the number of retry attempts and the intervals between retries directly at the step level within playbooks.

For more information on configuring and using action retries, see Configure action retries in playbooks.
entry.summary: Automated retries for playbook actions.
entry.title: Feature: New: Automated retries for playbook actions

entry.content:
Custom Fields Form widget is now supported in Playbook View

The Custom Fields Form widget is now supported in Playbook View.
entry.summary: Custom Fields Form widget now supported in Playbook View.
entry.title: Feature: Feature Announcement: Custom Fields Form widget in Playbook View

entry.content: Release 6.3.55 is now available for all regions.
entry.summary: Release 6.3.55 is now available.
entry.title: Announcement: New Release

entry.content:
Release 6.3.55 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions, as outlined in our Google SecOps release plan.

This release contains the following features:
entry.summary: Release 6.3.55 is rolling out to initial regions.
entry.title: Announcement: New Release

entry.content:
Automate tasks with Playbook Loops

This feature is in Preview.

Playbook functionality has been enhanced to include Playbook Loops. This feature update lets playbooks iterate over lists or entities, performing one or more actions for each item. It streamlines automation by eliminating the need for duplicated steps or custom actions when processing multiple items. You can configure Playbook Loops directly within a playbook or inside a playbook block.

For setup instructions and use case examples , see Automate tasks with Playbook Loops.
entry.summary: Streamline automation by iterating over lists or entities.
entry.title: Feature: Playbook Loops

entry.content:
Playbook Simulator enhancements for loops

The Playbook Simulator now supports visualization and debugging of playbooks that contain loops. This lets you clearly see and navigate through each loop iteration within the simulator viewer.

Additionally, the step display order has been updated to show actions from top to bottom (oldest at the top, newest at the bottom), with automatic scrolling to the most recent activity.

For more details, see Loops in the Playbook Simulator.
entry.summary: Visualize and debug playbooks with loops.
entry.title: Feature: Playbook Simulator loop enhancements

entry.content: Release 6.3.54 is now available for all regions.
entry.summary: Release 6.3.54 is now available.
entry.title: Announcement: Release Notes

entry.content:
Release 6.3.54 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions as listed here.

This release contains internal and customer bug fixes.
entry.summary: Release 6.3.54 is now available in initial regions, addressing internal and customer-reported bugs.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.54 Now Available

entry.content: Release 6.3.53 is now available for all regions.
entry.summary: The latest release of Chronicle SOAR, version 6.3.53, has been made available across all regions.
entry.title: Announcement: Chronicle SOAR Release 6.3.53 Now Available

entry.content:
Release 6.3.53 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions as listed here.

This release contains internal and customer bug fixes.
entry.summary: This release introduces bug fixes for internal and customer issues. It is currently being rolled out to the initial set of regions.
entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.53 Rollout Begins

entry.content: Release 6.3.52 is now available for all regions.
entry.summary: The latest release, version 6.3.52, is now available across all regions. This update includes various improvements and new features for the platform.
entry.title: Announcement: New release available

entry.content:
Release 6.3.52 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions as listed here.

This release contains the following feature:
entry.summary: Release 6.3.52 is now available in initial regions. This update includes new features and improvements.
entry.title: Announcement: New Release Available

entry.content:
Share Case Queue Filters

You can now share case queue filters with other users. These filters can be saved with specific criteria, such as assignee roles, and shared with individual users, SOC roles, or all users in your organization for quick access.

For more information, see Apply and save filters.
entry.summary: Users can now share saved case queue filters with specific criteria with other users, roles, or everyone in the organization for easier access.
entry.title: Feature: Share Case Queue Filters

entry.title: Announcement: New Release Available

entry.content:
Release 6.3.51 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions as listed here.

This release contains the following change.
entry.summary: Release 6.3.51 is now available in the initial set of regions. This update includes a new feature that will be detailed in upcoming communications.
entry.title: Announcement: New Release Available

entry.content:
Bulk Playbook Duplication Behavior Updated

When duplicating playbooks in bulk, the original selection is now preserved. Newly created copies are no longer automatically selected in the platform.
entry.summary: The platform no longer automatically selects newly created copies when duplicating playbooks in bulk. The original selection is now preserved.
entry.title: Changed: Bulk Playbook Duplication Behavior Updated

entry.title: Announcement: Release 6.3.48 Rollout Begins

entry.content:
Playbook Permissions: Support for API Key Roles

The platform has been updated to extend playbook permissions to also support the SOC Roles associated with API keys, in addition to the user SOC Roles.

This enhancement affects how integrations using API keys interact with playbooks that have specific permission configurations. For example, GitSync now uses this capability to synchronize playbooks with restricted permissions.

For more information on how playbook permissions work with users and API keys, see Playbook permissions.

For specific instructions on configuring GitSync with restricted playbooks, see GitSync - Work with playbook permissions.
entry.summary: Playbook permissions now support API key roles, enhancing how integrations with specific permission configurations interact with playbooks. This change impacts features like GitSync, which now synchronizes playbooks with restricted permissions.
entry.title: Feature: API Key Role Support for Playbook Permissions

entry.content:
Advanced Reports: Case Custom Fields

Advanced Reports (Looker) has been enhanced to include support for custom fields created for Cases.

This enhancement allows users to leverage organization-specific data captured in custom fields to gain deeper insights and create tailored visualizations within Looker reports. Specific LookML formulas and filtering guidance are now available.

For more information on how to use custom fields in Advanced Reports, see Use Custom Fields in Advanced Reports.
entry.summary: Looker reports now support custom fields for Cases, enabling users to analyze organization-specific data and create tailored visualizations. Guidance on LookML formulas and filtering is available.
entry.title: Feature: Advanced Reports Now Support Case Custom Fields
